question: What is the primary purpose of the PO Sync meeting in SAFe?
options: To assign individual tasks to team members
To synchronize and align Product Owners with the Product Manager and ensure backlog alignment
To conduct performance reviews for team members
To finalize the project budget
answer: To synchronize and align Product Owners with the Product Manager and ensure backlog alignment
rationale: The PO Sync meeting is designed to synchronize and align Product Owners with the Product Manager, ensuring that the backlogs are aligned with the program vision and objectives.

question: Which of the following are key activities during the PO Sync meeting?
options: Reviewing progress towards PI Objectives
Updating the ART Backlog
Assigning tasks to team members
Identifying and managing dependencies
Conducting technical design sessions
answer: Reviewing progress towards PI Objectives
Updating the ART Backlog
Identifying and managing dependencies
rationale: During the PO Sync meeting, Product Owners and the Product Manager review progress towards PI Objectives, update the ART Backlog, and identify and manage dependencies to ensure alignment and address any issues.

question: Who typically facilitates the PO Sync meeting?
options: Scrum Master
Release Train Engineer (RTE)
Product Manager
System Architect
answer: Product Manager
rationale: The Product Manager typically facilitates the PO Sync meeting, ensuring that Product Owners are aligned with the overall program vision and objectives.

question: Which of the following best describe the System Demo in SAFe?
options: A daily stand-up meeting
A demonstration of the integrated work of all teams on the Agile Release Train (ART)
A financial review session
A showcase of completed features to stakeholders
An individual team retrospective
answer: A demonstration of the integrated work of all teams on the Agile Release Train (ART)
A showcase of completed features to stakeholders
rationale: The System Demo is a comprehensive demonstration of the integrated work of all teams on the ART, showcasing completed features to stakeholders and providing an opportunity for feedback.

question: What is the main objective of the Innovation and Planning (IP) Iteration in SAFe?
options: To assign tasks to team members
To provide time for innovation, exploration, and planning activities
To conduct daily stand-up meetings
To finalize the project budget
answer: To provide time for innovation, exploration, and planning activities
rationale: The IP Iteration provides teams with dedicated time for innovation, exploration, learning, and planning activities, as well as for handling unplanned work and technical debt.

question: Which of the following activities are typically performed during the IP Iteration?
options: Refactoring and addressing technical debt
Developing new user stories
Conducting team training and skill development
Planning the next PI
Finalizing feature implementations
answer: Refactoring and addressing technical debt
Conducting team training and skill development
Planning the next PI
rationale: During the IP Iteration, teams focus on refactoring, addressing technical debt, conducting training, and planning for the next Program Increment (PI), among other improvement activities.

question: What is the primary focus of Inspect and Adapt (I&A) in SAFe?
options: Assigning tasks to team members
Reviewing and improving the current PI and processes
Conducting daily stand-up meetings
Finalizing the project budget
answer: Reviewing and improving the current PI and processes
rationale: Inspect and Adapt (I&A) is a structured event at the end of each PI where teams review the PI outcomes, reflect on processes, identify improvements, and create action plans to enhance future performance.

question: Which of the following are components of the Inspect and Adapt (I&A) event?
options: PI System Demo
Quantitative and qualitative measurement of PI performance
Problem-Solving Workshop
Assigning individual tasks for the next PI
Budget review and adjustment
answer: PI System Demo
Quantitative and qualitative measurement of PI performance
Problem-Solving Workshop
rationale: The Inspect and Adapt event includes a PI System Demo, quantitative and qualitative measurement of PI performance, and a Problem-Solving Workshop to identify and address improvement areas.

question: How often should the System Demo occur in SAFe?
options: Once at the end of the PI
Once a month
At the end of each iteration
Whenever a feature is completed
answer: At the end of each iteration
rationale: The System Demo should occur at the end of each iteration to showcase the integrated work of all teams and gather feedback regularly.

question: What role does the Release Train Engineer (RTE) play during PI Execution?
options: Assigning individual tasks to team members
Facilitating ART events and ensuring smooth PI Execution
Defining the product Vision
Managing the project budget
answer: Facilitating ART events and ensuring smooth PI Execution
rationale: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) facilitates ART events, coordinates activities, and ensures that PI Execution proceeds smoothly by addressing impediments and fostering collaboration.

question: Which of the following are benefits of conducting regular System Demos?
options: Early detection of integration issues
Continuous feedback from stakeholders
Improved team morale through recognition of achievements
Detailed financial tracking
Reduced need for documentation
answer: Early detection of integration issues
Continuous feedback from stakeholders
Improved team morale through recognition of achievements
rationale: Regular System Demos help in early detection of integration issues, provide continuous feedback from stakeholders, and improve team morale by recognizing and showcasing their work.

question: What is the main purpose of the Problem-Solving Workshop during Inspect and Adapt?
options: To assign tasks for the next PI
To collaboratively identify root causes of problems and develop improvement plans
To conduct individual performance reviews
To finalize the project budget
answer: To collaboratively identify root causes of problems and develop improvement plans
rationale: The Problem-Solving Workshop is designed to collaboratively identify the root causes of issues encountered during the PI and develop actionable improvement plans to enhance future performance.

question: Which practices support effective PI Objectives?
options: Aligning objectives with the program Vision
Making objectives vague to allow flexibility
Ensuring objectives are measurable and achievable
Focusing solely on technical deliverables
Prioritizing customer value and business outcomes
answer: Aligning objectives with the program Vision
Ensuring objectives are measurable and achievable
Prioritizing customer value and business outcomes
rationale: Effective PI Objectives are aligned with the program Vision, are measurable and achievable, and prioritize customer value and business outcomes to ensure that the work contributes meaningfully to the program goals.
